37_3.name: Salmon, tuna, and other fatty fish
37_3.description: Studies show that eating fish high in omega-3 fatty acids lowers your risk of cardiovascular disease. Yet taking omega-3 supplements may not have the same benefit.

39_3.name: Cakes, pies, biscuits, cookies, crackers, doughnuts, and other baked goods
39_3.description: Trans fat might taste good, but it's not good for you. This unhealthy type of fat raises your LDL cholesterol level, making you more likely to have heart disease, stroke, and type 2 diabetes.

40_3.name: French fries and other fried foods
